intro: Lobivia tiegeliana var. peclardiana, commonly known as the Peclard's lobivia, is a compact, low-growing cactus native to the arid regions of South America. It features short, cylindrical stems covered in white to pale green tubercles, which help reduce water loss in its harsh environment. The plant produces clusters of small, yellow flowers during the spring and summer months. Its leaves are reduced to spines, and it is well adapted to full sun and well-draining soil. This variety is prized for its unique appearance and is often cultivated in rock gardens or as a container plant.
